website_summaries.verdict: For casual fishing trips, this is a flexible crab trap at a great price.
pros: Can easily be cast from a fishing rod or by hand depending on available equipment
Long rope allows for depths of around 100 feet
cons: Included rope is prone to fraying when used in rough or fast-moving waters

customer_reviews.title: Great trap, used it to catch dungeness in Northern ...
customer_reviews.text: Great trap, used it to catch dungeness in Northern California. One morning I pulled 6 crabs out of this trap and we only pulled three all morning from our hoop style traps. I got this because its compact and I can motocamp with it very easily. I DID NOT use the original rope that it came with. I picked up a cheap 100ft rope separate. I will probably only keep one of these but for the size the quality and use was great. In the pic you can see I had to tie a rock to it because the current was so strong it wouldnt get to the bottom. This is an issue with almost any trap but a cage.
customer_reviews.author: Wesavesharks

customer_reviews.title: No 100' Rope
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Crab trap but needs some tightening of the some of the strapping. Only gripe with this product is that it says it comes with a 100' rope. Opened up my package when it came and there was NO 100' rope. Would have been nice if it was there because that was the main reason I bought this crab trap instead of the other ones that didn't come with a rope.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good casting crab trap for the $
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I have used it on blue crabs in a light current. Opened every time and landed upright. The bait bag works great easy to load and unload with whatever bait you want. The crabs do manage to get tangled up some times but what net doesn't have that problem with crabs. The 100 ft line is ok but I plan to change it . Just make sure to wash it after every time you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after a complete fail at the Crab Snare. This trap was just what I needed for getting a few crabs for dinner and to just have some fun with. I decided to not use the rope and tied the basket to my ugly stick fishing pole to cast out off the pier. Gave it a cast about every 20 minutes for a few hours and came home with 5 red rock crabs. I probably caught about 15 total but most were too small (including dungeness). The bait bag was easy to use and I was crabbing in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy cook

customer_reviews.title: I caught crabs...
customer_reviews.text: ...and it was fun. Ah, if I had dime for every time I said that. But this was fun. I don't have prior ocean crabbing experience to compare to, but we put some chicken in the little pouch (which I secured with a couple extra zip ties as suggested in another review), threw the little bastid out in the water, pulled it in 5 min later and there was crab in it. We didn't catch any huge ones or enough to eat, but it was fun. Looking forward to warmer weather again.
customer_reviews.author: Itsrob11

customer_reviews.title: Works great for crab, as stated
customer_reviews.text: First time I threw it out, brought in many several varieties of crabs, including an undersized dungeness and a rock crab. The line does tangle quite a bit as you need to pull in quickly to keep it closed. There were a lot of small kelp crab which got away. Those little buggers are quick to squirm away, but I didn't actually keep any of the 3 kelp crabs that I put in the bucket. I haven't yet tried to cast from a pole, but I suppose it would work and you wouldn't need the rope that comes with it, then no tangling. I ordered 2 more for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy C

customer_reviews.title: Good trap for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great crab trap for crabbing of a dock our jetty. Nice size bait pouch. Do wish it had a center bait bar to attach chicken too. 100 foot rope is very light and doesn't handle well in mild surf. Once I replaced it to paracord it worked well. Weighted down with 4 oz weights. Need to add 2 to 4 more oz to keep it from flowing with the river current. Would buy more of these traps.
customer_reviews.author: MommaFaith

customer_reviews.title: Great little net trap.
customer_reviews.text: This worked so well! It's smaller than most others we saw on the pier, but it does it's job! I would get two so you can rotate nets. This most crab we pulled up in one catch with this net was 4. Great value! I loved how when tension is applied that the net closes up. It's a little extra comfort that the crab aren't going to escape
customer_reviews.author: kdizz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty little ring
customer_reviews.text: Pretty little ring, it catches crabs but I made a minor tweak before using. The mesh bait bag needs more zip ties on it to hold it secure. I had bought 2 the first one the mesh bag broke off so the 2nd one I added 4 more and its held up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Fine Build To
customer_reviews.text: Go to the place where you are going to buy the bait and purchase a trap locally. Every crab likes a special kinda of trap. For example . THIS IS WAY TO BIG FOR BLUE CRABS. Support your loc businesses. But a trap near the water and get the WHOLE experience
customer_reviews.author: Liger J. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Very basic
customer_reviews.text: You have to check every fifteen minutes or crabs may eat all your bait. You cannot just leave unattended and expect to come back to some crabs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: My first trap net. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I switched from using crab snares at the beach to using this off piers and jetties in Northern California. It's incredibly easy. And I've never had a bad day at the ocean with this. Folds up conveniently for simple carrying and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Diastematic

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Not at all impressed. Poor design. Do not buy as this trapnonly catches your money and knots.
customer_reviews.author: Mb

customer_reviews.title: Trap was fine but must buy new line
customer_reviews.text: The trap was good but the line thaf came with pre-tied was very bad quality, I tied the line at a dock but the line ripped and lost thr trap. Beware
customer_reviews.author: PJ319

customer_reviews.title: Best trap for attended shore casting for crabs
customer_reviews.text: For shore casting for crab from a dock, these are the best things going. I've used these for years, having found them in BC Canada. They are uncommon down in the states. When pulling in you keep all of the crabs, whereas for ring traps the crabs shuffle off when they feel you're pulling up the trap and the jig's up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Seriously my MVP at the crab dock
customer_reviews.text: These are such a great value for how well they work. I have brought mine with me on 5 trips and they still hold up strong. I did replace the 100 ft rope since the one that comes with it isn't the best.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than a boat and round traps
customer_reviews.text: Crabs sacrificed themselves to this trap. Cast from shore, swinging round and round over my head with a chicken leg for bait. Limits every day.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gc

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the better brands. It last much longer than the Danielson ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better brands. It last much longer than the Danielson ones I got from WM. I've used it for 15 trips to the pier this year already. The bait bag is nice, but I dont use it. I just ziptie my bait (chicken) to the metal rod itself. I've caught many Red Rock Crabs and Dungeness Crabs. I hate the rope thought, it tangles like a b****. I currently have 6 of these, a few from 2 years ago. I just took the 2yr old ones apart, and removed the rusted out torsion spring and made my own using music wire and now it's working like a champ again.
customer_reviews.author: San S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked just fine, arrived in good order
customer_reviews.text: Caught a crab off the pier using fresh, raw chicken drumsticks and wings as bait. Worked just fine, arrived in good order. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: AbrahamLawrence

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made, wasn't able to catch anything Used as recommended. Didn't see how crabs to get in small opening
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Very good way to cach crabs
customer_reviews.text: Others were using the heavy and large rings. These were easy and worked great. We had lots of fun. There's a pouch to insert chicken legs and pin shut.
customer_reviews.author: Paul O'Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Very delicate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trap do to the fact it was cheap and could be thrown a good distance. However, the second time I threw it out, the bait-bag separated and was forever lost in the surf. Although, it actually managed to catch a crab the first cast. I had no problems returning it, however, it is annoying to have the crab trap rendered useless after 1 day of use....
customer_reviews.author: Jeff m

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use & so lite!! Beats all the heavy big old traps by far!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect perfect gift for hubby! We're having crab overnight with such ease!
customer_reviews.author: Mjws

customer_reviews.title: Small but very efficient crab fishing tool!
customer_reviews.text: Probably most efficient tool for crab fishing. By using it, my son wins over my big trap 5:3 and 5:2 in the last two times. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Integrity in question here.
customer_reviews.text: Item was used, net was semi repaired, still see partes of netting still frayed or broken. No rope which listing states with 100' rope.
customer_reviews.author: B C.

customer_reviews.title: the net itself is NOTHING but cloth/cotton
customer_reviews.text: This will NOT last long, i don't know WHY they even sell this thing. For the money, get something else...........!
customer_reviews.author: walter

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Crappy rope started to crack during the first use. With new rope works great
customer_reviews.author: v p zembruski

customer_reviews.title: It's not going to fill the cooler but fun to play around with while killing time
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well, I caught a few blue crab at a lower tide while waiting for a bite on fishing rod.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I plan on buying more for our next crabbing vacation
customer_reviews.text: These caught so many crab for us. Very light and easy to use. Took a little practice to throw it out really far but it was fun learning. Less than half the price of the ones sold at the ocean too!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Hooker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a boat and you are crabbing off a pier, this will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use let’s the kids pull there own crab in!
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Small crab trap that works!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little trap.It is much nicer than I thought it would be!
customer_reviews.author: terry walker

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job catching crabs
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old son asked for a crab trap to use with his grandfather on trips to Maine. He has used this several times and has always caught at least one crab. It is easy to use and easy to cast. This will definitely get a lot of use!
customer_reviews.author: Karenlost

customer_reviews.title: Bait bag falls off easy, take extra zip ties.
customer_reviews.text: Overall you can’t go wrong for the money. Caught many crab using these, and fun every time.
customer_reviews.author: Wthomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Loved that it came with harness and some others don’t. It’s also bigger than others this style. I would say it could probably fit 6 or so crabs. (We we’re crabbing for Red and Dungeness)
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Kay Cox

customer_reviews.title: It arrived on time but the rope and netting was ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time but the rope and netting was torn. I had to be MacGyver to fix it. It still didn't work right and ended up buying a different crabbing trap at Big 5's.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Kamuta

customer_reviews.title: It is cheap and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it is ok but easy to break by sea lion
customer_reviews.author: WAndY

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. Very flimsy if I do say so myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Ward

customer_reviews.title: One-and-Done
customer_reviews.text: The trap is very easy to use and light weight! We had the most luck with it in shallow water where we could see the crabs, place the trap near them, and haul it up once they were on it. The only problem with this trap is that it's a one-and-done item. It was very common for the crabs to get caught in the netting, with the only solution to be cutting the cutting to retrieve the crabs
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Vartanian

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for crabbing until a giant sea lion snaps ...
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for crabbing until a giant sea lion snaps that bait from the net together with the bait holder in it. It would be better if it had some type of reel for the rope.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver O.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was not to happy with it compared to other casting crab traps.
customer_reviews.author: Kip Nissen

customer_reviews.title: Could be a great value if it allowed the crabs to be removed.
customer_reviews.text: The crabs get tangled and caught in the nylon netting. There's a reason all other crab traps are made with metal grids. Fatal design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Crawford

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product & it is what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This product is what I wanted & it meet all my expectations. I look forward to being able to put it to use.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Item appears to meet our satisfaction, but we haven't ...
customer_reviews.text: Item appears to meet our satisfaction, but we haven't had a chance to use it yet. We can give a far more accurate rating when it's been but to the test.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Montoya

product_meta.title: KUFA Sports Stainless Steel Frame Casting Crab Trap with 100' Rope (CR56)
product_meta.description: This trap can be cast by hand or with use of a fishing rod Includes 100 feet of smooth casting braided rope A great trap for use from the dock, shore or boat; for depths down to 100 feet Size: L 22 x H 12 x W 2 Weight 1lbs
feature_bullets: This trap can be cast by hand or with use of a fishing rod
Includes 100 feet of smooth casting braided rope
A great trap for use from the dock, shore or boat; for depths down to 100 feet
Stainless Steel frame with plastic bait bag

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
